title: Mild Fever Home Monitoring
content: For mild fever in adults, hydration, rest, and temperature monitoring are usually recommended. Seek urgent care if fever is high, persistent, or accompanied by breathing difficulty, chest pain, confusion, or dehydration signs.

title: Cough Risk Signals
content: A short-term cough without breathing distress is often manageable with fluids and rest. Escalate care for persistent cough with shortness of breath, chest pain, blood in sputum, or high fever.

title: Chest Pain and Breathing Distress
content: New chest pain, severe shortness of breath, fainting, or neurologic deficits can indicate emergency conditions and require immediate emergency services evaluation.

title: Knee Pain and Low-Impact Activity
content: For mild chronic knee pain, low-impact exercise options include walking, cycling, and swimming. Weight management and adequate protein intake can support joint function while reducing mechanical load.

title: Vegetarian Weight Management Principles
content: A calorie deficit with sufficient protein supports healthy weight reduction. Vegetarian protein sources include lentils, beans, tofu, tempeh, and dairy alternatives fortified with calcium and vitamin D.

title: Appointment Routing Guidelines
content: Emergency risk requires immediate emergency services. Urgent but stable concerns should receive same-day urgent care. Routine concerns can be seen in primary care within days, with telemedicine as an initial triage option.
